rules: NEVER use AI attribution in commit messages (no 'Generated with Claude Code' or Co-Authored-By lines)
Always read existing files before making changes
Prefer editing existing files over creating new ones when possible
Use TodoWrite tool to track progress on complex tasks
Follow established git workflow and branch naming conventions
Reference issue numbers in commits when applicable
Update ALL affected documentation proactively without being asked
Test that changes don't break existing functionality
ALWAYS run 'npm run quality-check' before any git push or commit
NEVER push code that fails linting, formatting, type checking, or tests
Fix all unused variables and ensure consistent code formatting
Run 'npm run lint' to auto-fix formatting issues before manual fixes

When adding labels to GitHub issues: First check existing labels with 'gh label list', look for semantically similar labels, use existing ones when possible, only create new labels when genuinely needed
documentation_checklist: Getting started guides if user experience changes
Docker compose comments for new services

always_include: Reference to issue numbers when applicable
Clear description of what changed and why

workflow_principles.scope_boundaries: Ask for clarification when scope is unclear
workflow_principles.technical_approach: Propose options when multiple paths exist
workflow_principles.dependencies: Stop and ask when blockers are found

testing.coverage_requirements: Maintain high test coverage for all code changes
testing.unit_tests: Write unit tests for all new functions, methods, and business logic
testing.component_tests: Add React component tests using testing library best practices
testing.integration_tests: Test page functionality and user interactions
testing.edge_cases: Test error conditions, boundary values, and failure scenarios
testing.regression_tests: Add tests that prevent reoccurrence of fixed bugs
testing.test_before_commit: Run existing tests before committing to ensure no breakage
testing.seo_testing: Test SEO meta tags, structured data, and accessibility
testing.performance_testing: Test page load times and Core Web Vitals metrics

repository_context.service_role: Public marketing website - showcases Loqa platform and provides user-facing information

microservice_architecture.structure: Part of loqalabs/ microservice ecosystem - each subfolder is an independent git repository
microservice_architecture.check_before_cloning: Always check if ../SERVICE_NAME exists before attempting to clone repositories
microservice_architecture.website_role: Public-facing marketing site - mostly independent of other services
microservice_architecture.content_coordination: May need to coordinate messaging and technical content with main project

cross_service_changes.content_sync: Coordinate technical documentation with main repo when needed
cross_service_changes.merge_order: Can be updated independently - no service dependencies

tagging_workflow.step_1: Always run 'gh label list' first to see existing labels
tagging_workflow.step_2: Look for semantically similar labels (e.g., 'dependencies' instead of 'deps', 'type: feature' instead of 'feature')
tagging_workflow.step_3: Use existing labels when they match the intent, even if wording is slightly different
tagging_workflow.step_4: Only create new labels when no existing label captures the concept
tagging_workflow.step_5: When creating new labels, follow existing naming patterns (e.g., 'area:', 'type:', 'priority:')

best_practices: Make changes easy to find and understand later
avoid: Making changes without understanding current state
Creating new files when editing existing ones works
Over-analyzing ideas that just need to be captured
